Articles.Content:
Found this video recently:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/RznZ_e6aDHc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Quite an interesting way to explain how certain aspect of physics works for lay people who are more interested in money than physics.

What do you think?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-30T18:07:04Z" title="03/30/2015 06:07  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 30, 2015</time> by RainDreamer**

Here's some examples of some landers, not sure what this has to do with the text of your post though.

![Phoenix_landing.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/6/6a/Phoenix_landing.jpg)

![640px-Apollo16LM.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Apollo16LM.jpg/640px-Apollo16LM.jpg)

![640px-Huygens_cutaway.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7a/Huygens_cutaway.jpg/640px-Huygens_cutaway.jpg)

> What do you think?

I think that 15 minute video could have been compressed down into a few paragraphs of text and two or three diagrams.

\*facepalm\* I accidently click restoring an old saved post and forgot to change the title. Lets do this again.

Please ignored the 2nd and 3rd post, I confused those poster. Just check the video. Sorry for the confusion.
